title: Angelina Jolie and brood board private jet ahead of Maleficent premiere
text:
Angelina Jolie and her brood board private jet (Picture: Backgrid)

Angelina Jolie has been joined by her brood while flying off around the world to promote her latest movie, Maleficent 2.

And now the family has been spotted heading into a private jet as they make their way to the UK for the London premiere.

Dressed head-to-toe in black, the mother-of-six looked in high spirits as she boarded the plane with her bambinos.

She’d paired her look with a black and navy bag, and a pair of oversized shades as she prepared for the long haul flight.

Following closely behind the 44-year-old was young star Zahara, 14, who had chosen to enjoy the journey in baggy trousers and a t-shirt.

Their sighting comes after the siblings had thrown their support behind their famous mum at the European premiere in Rome.

She looked in high spirits (Picture: Backgrid)

Pax, 15, and 11-year-old twins Vivienne and Knox had held back when making an appearance at the glamorous event, however, Shiloh, 13, and Zahara appeared to be having a blast.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Maddox, 18, had also joined the infamous actress at the Tokyo premiere from university in Seoul.

Five years after first donning the evil fairy’s horns in 2014, Ange has returned as Maleficent in soon-to-be-released Mistress Of Evil.

And this time she will be fighting for the love of Princess Aurora (Elle Fanning).

Ange had taken her bambinos with her (Picture: Backgrid)

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The villain is set to meet her match in the form of Queen Ingrith (played by Michelle Pfeiffer) who causes drama of explosive proportions when her son Prince Phillip proposes to Aurora.

Ahead of the release, Ange has spoken about the similarities between her own struggles and that of Maleficent’s, referencing the breakdown of her marriage to Brad Pitt in 2016.

Speaking to French magazine Madame, she explained: ‘I don’t what my fate holds but what I am convinced of is that I am in a period of transition, like a return to my roots, a return to myself. Because, I had lost myself a bit.

‘I felt a deep and genuine sadness, I was hurt. On the other hand, it was interesting to reconnect with this humility and even this insignificance I was feeling. Maybe this is what being human is in the end…

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘On top of all this, I suffered some health issues. All these things settle in you and remind you of how lucky you are of being alive.’

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil is in UK cinemas 18 October.

description: Angelina Jolie and her brood board private jet ahead of Maleficent's London premiere.
